title: Introduction to Algorithms
author: Thomas H. Cormen
details: A comprehensive guide to algorithms, covering sorting, searching, graph algorithms, and dynamic programming.

title: Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach
author: Kurose & Ross
details: An in-depth book on computer networking, focusing on application layer protocols, TCP/IP, and network security.

title: Operating System Concepts
author: Abraham Silberschatz
details: This book explains OS fundamentals, including process management, scheduling, memory management, and virtualization.

title: Database System Concepts
author: Abraham Silberschatz
details: Covers fundamental database concepts, including SQL, NoSQL, indexing, normalization, and transactions.

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
author: Stuart Russell & Peter Norvig
details: A detailed book on AI concepts, including search algorithms, machine learning, reinforcement learning, and NLP.

title: The C Programming Language
author: Brian W. Kernighan & Dennis M. Ritchie
details: A classic book on C programming covering syntax, pointers, memory management, and data structures.

title: Software Engineering
author: Ian Sommerville
details: Covers software development methodologies, Agile, testing, project management, and quality assurance.

title: Computer Organization and Design
author: David A. Patterson & John L. Hennessy
details: Explores computer architecture concepts, including RISC vs CISC, pipeline processing, and memory hierarchy.

title: Cryptography and Network Security
author: William Stallings
details: Provides an understanding of cryptography techniques, encryption, hashing, and network security protocols.

title: Computer Graphics: Principles and Practice
author: John F. Hughes
details: Covers the fundamentals of computer graphics, including rendering, ray tracing, shading, and OpenGL.
